website_summaries.verdict: The 27-inch Asus MG279Q monitor delivers solid gaming performance, thanks to AMD's FreeSync technology and a speedy 144Hz refresh rate.

customer_reviews.title: By far the most ridiculous IPS glow I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: This display could be great - if it wasn't for the bad quality control. If the display shows a bright / white picture its just fine. But do not dare to watch a movie with darker scenes or black bars, play a game with other colors than white or try to edit images using photoshop etc. in a darker environment. I've uploaded an image, so you can see for yourself. It should display an all black image. Well, it doesnt. To be honest, there's even more yellow than black. I do know that the manufacturers try to sell us a certain amount of IPS glow as normal. But this is madness. Cant recommend this display.
customer_reviews.author: The Mailman

customer_reviews.title: Good screen for your average gamer consumer
customer_reviews.text: I love this gaming monitor as casual gamer. Amazing step up from my previous basic monitors. I do notice though that the best mode seems to be cinema mode despite whatever I'm doing. I just feel picture quality declines when on gaming mode or other settings. At the end of the day, I'm not a monitor expert, and I'm just an average joe who likes to have a nice visual with high refresh rate for games, and this monitor does it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Azt

customer_reviews.title: A risky purchase, or was it?
customer_reviews.text: Yes. It was. At the time of writing this review, no fewer than 25% of everyone who bought one of these monitors said they were dissapointed with it. I am one of those people. Unacceptable backlight bleed? Check. Innolux panel flickers and glitches? Check. Werid yellow tinge across some of the screen? Check-mate. I cannot reccomend this monitor knowing for a mere £30 more, ASUS make the XG32VQ.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: Item is as I expected, no damage what's so ever, slight light bleed at corners, that's it, as monitor mg279q is just superior 2k with my r9 390 is more than enough to get bets gaming experience yet available, 4k just need to wait, to much to pay for dat kind of improvement.. And yes item both from Amazon warehouse so I got two extra power cables, and vga cable, yes vga, there is no vga port guys :D so I used my old HDMI cable until I received new display port cable. Getting this monitor was best choice of upgrade from 1080p, fast, colorful, big and way more emersive than 1080p buy it..
customer_reviews.author: WakeUP

customer_reviews.title: Godd all round monitor.
customer_reviews.text: 2k IPS monitor. Size is about right to avoid viewing off-axis issues on the edges of the monitor. Has the benefits of IPS for colour and high refresh rate if you play first person shooters or similar. Some IPS glow (unavoidable due to the tech) limits the deep black contrasts. Improved resolution over HD standard is noticeable but not dramatic.
customer_reviews.author: xenus

customer_reviews.title: Wery good black picture look better than an adus 27 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: Wery good black picture look better than an adus 27 inch blur free tn pannel 1080p version i owned Input lag is good can still play same lvl as on tn 144hz and still i can see alot more than tn pannel due to colors look realy vivid just have to play whit back light as in some modes it just unreal cyany blue have to play in light room other way see backlight still alot less than tn pannel whit calibrated whites and contrast
customer_reviews.author: Dmitrijs

customer_reviews.title: Though this is a nice piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Shame. Though this is a nice piece of kit, there are backlight issues. The backlight leaks into the black, which means there is a torch light effect in dark areas. This is a bummer when watching movies, and when working at night.
customer_reviews.author: tdassler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent looking and functioning monitor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent looking and functioning monitor. Works exceptionally well With my 1070 8GB. Overall 1440p at 144hz is the sweet spot for higher end rigs. This monitor comes with a control stick on the back of the screen which makes navigating the screens menus incredibly easy. The only draw back with this monitor I would say is that the size of the stand is quite substantial but if you are looking to put this on a monitor stand you will be fine! Overall this monitor looks great which the 1440p resolution and thin bezels alongside a functional high refresh rate. Would definitely recommend this monitor to anybody with a fairly beefy rig. 9/10!
customer_reviews.author: Fraser Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new but got a refurb.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a broken stand and somebody had the cheek to put it on top together with the manuals and cable, and it arrived without a UK power plug. Stuck pixel at the bottom, backlight bleed was actually OK, i would have kept it if not for the stuck pixel even i paid for a new monitor and i clearly for a refurb model. replacement should be on it's way hopefully it cant be worse.
customer_reviews.author: Lun He

customer_reviews.title: Buy new. Not from warehouse.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is great when you get a good one. Bought two from Amazon Warehoue for 40 pounds less than the new price and the first had to white pressure points and the second had a dead pixel. There is a reason the warehouse deals were returned. Most are people (like me) who are returning and the white spot or two are within the margin or error that Asus has for 'like-new'. Bought a new one for the 40 quid premium and it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Good screen.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these and they are great for 1440p gaming at 144Hz. Never had a problem with quality control issues like some other reviewers seem to have had. It is an IPS panel so backlight bleed is more pronounced than other monitor types, but honestly I've never noticed anything wrong when using it. Settings are garbage out of the box, but a quick google search will show you how to set it up so it looks decent.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect, but a few minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Near perfect monitor for the price. Listing the flaws, assume everything else is perfect. Flaws: Controls on the side are fiddly. No UK plug adaptor, or cable. Stickers leave a little residue, but removable after a bit of elbow grease. Included cables are plenty, but generally quite short.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Sapora

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor all round.
customer_reviews.text: Just a fantastic monitor, looks amazing, colours are great and freesync is a godsend. The build quality is top notch and the stand is a revelation after coming from a DGM 1440p monitor (which I recommend you avoid like the plague). For £370 from Amazon Warehouse with just some slightly damaged packaging (everything else was sealed and brand new) an absolute bargain. Also for anyone else wondering. The included Mini Displayport to Displayport cable works at 1440p with Freesync perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Burgess

customer_reviews.title: No alternative for these specs
customer_reviews.text: This is the only one monitor you can find IPS, 144 Hz and has a low response time like 4 ms. Yes, it seems a bit glowing when you take a photo in a dark room but it's only visible for some angles (not like in the photos), so I still prefer an IPS rather than a TN because its colours changing every angle and worse than glowing for one angle. I must admit that if all these people hadn't mention about it I wouldn't recognize. Also, I read some forums and most people say if its not too annoying this must be normal for an IPS screen.
customer_reviews.author: Emre D.

customer_reviews.title: 144hz and 1440p which truly is the best gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: Verry expencive. only buy this if you want to be on the bleeding edge of technology. This is one of the first to offer ips, 144hz and 1440p which truly is the best gaming experience. Just look at how fast monitors are evolving, i cant wait to see what's round the corner. Nvidia supporting freesync *fingers crossed*
customer_reviews.author: M Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It does not get any better!
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, 144Hz running with a GTX 970. Solid build quility. I find the basic setting a bit bright but other than that its great! USB 3.0 works great with my mouse and keyboard. I cant really fault it!
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, no speakers
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is good, however there aren't built in speakers as the Amazon page says there are. This annoyed me. I was also expecting to be able to adjust the height but I guess these are all features of one of the other models.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Great IPS 144Hz monitor for gaming etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor ASSUMING you get one which arrives with no dead pixels. Other than that, flawless for my needs - very good colour calibration too.
customer_reviews.author: Seaulone

customer_reviews.title: Cost-effective winner in 27 inches
customer_reviews.text: I also have the PG279Q model and I see no difference in perfomance of daily activities/gaming, despite the difference of G-Sync (PG279Q) and Freesync (MG279Q) with a G-Sync based laptop (Clevo P640RE).
customer_reviews.author: Cash365

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed with backlight bleed
customer_reviews.text: Well was hoping that these reviews about backlight bleed were backdated and non occuring now but guess not.. yet to test out 144hz as in the process of getting a new pc..
customer_reviews.author: Martyn

customer_reviews.title: Yet another bleeder :(
customer_reviews.text: Well it's a great shame as the backlight bleed has ruined what would have been an overwhelmingly positive experience. if your lucky and get a panel without the bleed then well done as it's an epiphany using this monitor and i absolutely would have another if i was sure i would get a good one. To be frank why should you spend a not inconsiderable amount of money on the roll of poor quality control dice. So a refund was my course of action and i would imagine i will go with a TN panel instead.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Stuck / dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: Developed some stuck pixels, returned after a couple of months. Shame as otherwise was great. Really nice contrast, brightness and colour rendition. Stand is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Packing
customer_reviews.text: I like the monitor a lot. Very smooth. It's been 2 hours since I got the delivery of it and is still working however, the box that it came with was damaged. The monitor works but, I'm concerned if anything bad will develop.
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof Wnuk

customer_reviews.title: My favorite monitor
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor! Great Colors and viewing angles. Having a refresh rate of 144 herz makes Gaming very smooth if your PC can handle it. My model got no backlight bleed at all even though i bought it as a warehouse deals product.
customer_reviews.author: DaTraktor

customer_reviews.title: Terrible IPS glow and backlight bleed
customer_reviews.text: Stuck pixels that I could not fix. Terrible IPS glow and backlight bleed. This seems to be the state of monitors nowadays,
customer_reviews.author: Brian Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Plug
customer_reviews.text: This product came with a 2 pin EU plug instead of a 3 pin UK & Ireland plug which I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Taniane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no issue with IPS bleed or dead pixels. Amazing quality
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, cant see any problems so far like some other reviews ive seen
customer_reviews.author: The G Legend

customer_reviews.title: Formidable gaming display.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant monitor, let down only by it's IPS glow around the corners, but this is only a problem when the screen is either completely black, or particular scenes are showing that highlight the issue. During general use it isn't noticeable. The design of the Monitor itself is fantastic, easy to find and use buttons on the back, easy to tilt and rotate and the picture reproduction is excellent. Have not looked back once I saw my games running at 1440p! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful. Not to hard to get you head around ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Not to hard to get you head around the settings.
customer_reviews.author: pint of plain

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control. Only buy if you are a gambler.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. Monitor came full of dead pixels/stuck pixels and has a lot of backlight bleed. Unacceptable for a monitor of this price.

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: good quality screen. I use this screen for general PC use
customer_reviews.author: philip huw
